MD_Tools — Molecular Dynamics tools¶

This module provides some tools for Molecular Dynamics simulations.

Module Syntax¶

Empty.

Module Contents¶

MD_Tools.dump_gromacs_snapshots(trajectory_file, tpr_file, delta_t, new_pdb_path)¶

This function dumps a pdb snapshot at the given time interval. The data will be stored in the new pdb path.

MD_Tools.calculate_rmsd_from_pdbmodel(pdb_model_path, pdb_frame_dir, ref_pdb_path, atom_types, delta_t)¶

Docstring missing.

MD_Tools.calculate_rmsf_from_pdbmodel(pdb_model_path, pdb_frame_dir, fit_atom_types = None, rmsf_type = None)¶

Docstring missing.

MD_Tools.calculate_center_of_mass(res)¶

Docstring missing.

MD_Tools.calculate_rmsd_from_trajectory(traj_file, tpr_file, delta_t, ref_pdb_path, atom_types = None)¶

This function returns two lists, which contain the time and the rmsd to the given reference structure path. The function extracts snapshots from the trajectory file and stores them in /dev/shm.

MD_Tools.calculate_rmsf_from_trajectory(traj_file, tpr_file, delta_t, fit_atom_types = None, rmsf_type = None)¶

This function returns two lists, one with a list of indieces (e.g. res numbers) and one with the calculated rmsfs. The unit of the rmsf is Angstrom.

Parameters:
  • fit_atom_types – atom types that are used to fit the trajectory onto the reference structure
  • rmsf_type – ‘res’, ‘CA’, None; types that are used for the calculation of the rmsf. ‘res’ means rmsf per residue, ‘CA’ calculates the rmsf for each c alpha atom and None for the geometric center of the protein.
